div.pre: 2124 Avola, 1888 (108 part) Burial: c. 360 B.C. (Baldwin) Contents: 34 AV Syracuse: 14 100-litra. MFA 1983.238 * Amphipolis: 1 st. Abydus: 1 st. Lampsacus: 14 st. Persia: 4 darics * This coin is not known to the earliest accounts; it appears first in Jameson Cat. 3, no. 1941 Disposition: London 10 Syracuse (NC 1892, p. 2, illus.), 1 Lampsacus (NC 1890, p. 324, illus.; 1891, p. 116); Jameson 1 Amphipolis (1941), 1 Lampsacus (1439); Greenwell 1 Lampsacus (NC 1890, p. 25, illus.). Also Löbbecke, Montagu and J. Hirsch Nov. 27, 1905, no. 207 (see Vorwort). For other Lamp- sacus see A. Baldwin, AJN 1924, nos. 4a, 8a, c, 9a, b, 13a, 15a, 18d, 19d, 24a Löbbecke, ZfN 1890, pp. 167-79, illus. Orsi, AttiMemIIN 1917, pp. 6-7 Regling, ZfN 1931, p. 28 Jenkins (ANSCent. p. 375) notes that Löbbeckes's account confuses two hd. of different dates, one of AV, the other of AR. For the AR hd. (included under Noe 108) see no. 2169 below
